page.title: 06LANGTON/BURYTHORPE CHURCHES.
page.content: { CHURCH OF St.ANDREW. } This is a very old church,parts of it dating back to the 12th.Century.It is made of hand-cut limestone and the chisel marks in the stonework are still very clear.Its Chancel arch,font and bells are original. The church itself was given to Old Malton Priory by{BURGA de VESCY}around 1170,whose family held this manor in the 14th.Century.Despite being rebuilt in the 1820's to include a stained glass window the church still has an effigy to{Mary Ingram}dated 1656,and its 17th.Century West Wall and ornate Chancel woodwork.A monument outside commerates a{Thomas Norcliffe}(1820) whose family bought Langton in 1615.{ { ALL SAINT'S CHURCH,BURYTHORPE}(1858) replaced a Norman church owned by { {KIRKHAM PRIORY}and retains an ancient cross outside and its Norman font.
